page.title: 14HALLATON BOTTLE-KICKING 1
page.content: {Bottle-kicking}and{hare pie scrambling take place on Easter Monday. They are centuries old customs for which Halla- ton is famous, at least throughout the county. The origins, probably connected with fertility rites, are lost in history. Crowds of several hundred gather in Hallaton, and the three pubs are open for most of the day. Some villagers participate: some leave for the day. The morning is taken up with a band playing first in Medbourne where the opposing team comes from, then around Hallaton from the Bewicke to the Fox, thence to the church where there is a service. After lunch the large hare pie, made to a secret recipe by one of the women of the village, is paraded from the Oak to Churchgate, where it is cut up by the Rector and some of it thrown to the crowd. (cont on page 15)
